hadiths.english_translation: And from the path of Ibn Abbas from him (the Prophet ﷺ) peace be upon him: He was asked about lost sheep, so he said: Take it, for it is for you or for your brother or for the wolf. Then it was said to him: What do you say about lost camels? So his face became red and he became angry, and said: What is your concern with them? With them is their hoof protection and their water container, they go to water and eat from trees until their owner finds them. Al-Rabi' said: Their hoof protection means their hooves. And their water container means they are patient about water because their stomachs preserve it for a time

hadiths.english_translation: Also from the path of Ibn Abbas: Zayd ibn Thabit picked up a purse containing one hundred dinars, so he came to the Prophet ﷺ, and he said to him: Announce it for one year, so whoever comes to you with a description, give it to him. So he came to him after completion of the year, and said to him: I announced it, O Messenger of Allah for one year, so he said to him: Announce it for another year. So he came to him after the end of the second year and informed him that he had announced it for another year, so he said: It is Allah's wealth, He gives it to whoever He wills. And in Mecca: Found items are not permissible except for one who announces them. In the Book of Hajj

hadiths.english_translation: Jabir ibn Zaid said: I heard from some of the Companions narrating from the Prophet ﷺ that he prohibited in slaughtering four methods: al-khazl, al-wakhz, al-nakh', and al-tardad. Al-Rabi' said: al-Khazl means inserting the blade under the skin and flesh and slaughtering on the opposite side. al-Wakhz means striking with the point of the blade into the neck of the animal after slaughtering. al-Nakh' means breaking the neck. al-Tardad means slaughtering with a dull blade that moves about in the flesh

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Aisha: People from the people of Medina came in the season of Adha during the time of the Prophet ﷺ, so the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Eat and give charity with what remains after three days. She said: When it was after that, it was said to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: The people benefit from their sacrifices and make abundant fat and take from them water containers. So the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: What is that? So they said: O Messenger of Allah, you forbade keeping the sacrifices after three days. So he said: I only forbade you because of the group of visitors who came upon you, so eat and give charity and store
